name: Run
how_to_perform:
1. Starting on the ground, choose a pace that suits your ability (you can begin with a walk if you feel anxious).
2. Bring one foot forward and place it firmly on the ground in front of you.
3. Keeping your back straight and core engaged, lift the other foot off the ground and bring it up to meet the first foot.
4. Repeat, alternating feet at a regular pace (around 1-2 seconds per step).
5. Keep your posture upright, shoulders relaxed, and engage your abdominal muscles to maintain balance throughout the entire process.
6. If needed, incorporate proper breathing techniques, exhaling as you land on each foot.
short_summary: Running engages multiple muscle groups including the core, legs, and glutes, requiring the use of oxygen-rich blood from throughout the body.
